name: The Half-full Mug
desc: You enter a lively and crowded tavern. There is a door to the North and West

name: The Manaa Waste
desc: Once a vibrant magical city, the remnants of the wasted realm stand as a warning to others. A cliff blocks any travel to the West.

name: The Spire of Lightning
desc: A place as dangerous as it is magical. Enter at your own risk.

name: The Land of Poison Tears
desc: A millenia of mining by the stone dwarves have rendered this land ill, and poison accompanies rain from the skies. Make haste: your only way out is due East.

name: The Wyvern Hills
desc: Flying lions - what could go wrong?

name: The Sea of Thene
desc: Dark seas stretch the horizon from North to South - the currently known edge of the world

name: The Pit of Eternal Night
desc: You are in a dark warren of caves. It's not really eternally night, but it's dark so we don't quibble.
SOUTH: The Citadel of the Lich Queen

name: The Twilight Vale
desc: You are in a forest of massive purple trees that cast an amethyst glow. It is very quiet, but you feel as though someone is watching you.

name: The Black Gauntlet of Sorrows
desc: A dark hallway stretches east, paintings of destruction reaching up beyond sight.
SOUTH: The Tower of Ulfang the Black

name: The Citadel of the Lich Queen
desc: No, she is of no relation to Arthas, thank you very much, and kindly asks you to leave.
SOUTH: The Prison of the Pelagic Wizards

name: Dacot
desc: An average city filled with average folk. Likely a good place to pick up provisions.
EAST: The Tower of Ulfang the Black
WEST: The Citadel of the Lich Queen

name: The Tower of Ulfang the Black
desc: Welcome to the Tower. Ulfang is really Ulbuckteeth.
